title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear to support children's healthcare access.
Whitaker's inspiration is her 8-year-old daughter who received crucial medical care at Mass. Eye and Ear.
The care included an MRI, sleep study, and surgery that successfully treated her daughter's severe sinus cysts.

title: A.J. Brown’s Eagles teammate doesn’t buy Patriots trade possibility
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots are considering trade options, possibly involving A.J. Brown, to strengthen their wide receiver lineup.
A.J. Brown dismissed Patriots trade rumors, calling his interactions with Edelman and Gronkowski 'trolling.'
ESPN's Adam Schefter sees a potential trade involving A.J. Brown and Patriots coach Mike Vrabel as plausible.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: The National Weather Service warns of heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding impacting southeast MA and RI from a nor'easter.
Forecasters predict the storm Sunday night to Monday could produce up to 15 inches of snow in metro Boston and stronger blizzard conditions in SE Mass.
Meteorologists caution about potential power outages due to heavy, wet snow and emphasize increased storm impact compared to previous snowfalls.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declined to respond to Sam Kennedy's comments regarding his departure from the Red Sox for the Cubs.
Bregman signed with the Cubs after they offered a no-trade clause, which was not included in Boston's proposal.
Despite leaving the Red Sox, Bregman has expressed fondness for his time with the team and its players.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now' (Redux) featuring Robert Duvall is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex.
'Blue Moon' with Ethan Hawke as lyricist Lorenz Hart is available on Netflix.
Season 2 of 'The Last Thing He Told Me' starring Jennifer Garner is streaming on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora says Marcelo Mayer must earn his spot on the Opening Day roster this spring training.
Mayer, 23, needs to improve his offensive performance after batting .228 in 44 games last season.
Mayer practiced mostly at second base with newcomer Caleb Durbin at third, amidst recent Red Sox infield acquisitions.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: A nor'easter is predicted to impact southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island Sunday night into Monday.
Meteorologists warn of heavy snow, strong winds, and potential coastal flooding in the affected areas.
The South Shore and Cape Cod might see snow accumulations of a foot or more.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in person in court, dressed in black and using a wheelchair, for the first time since 2023.
Clancy faces three counts of murder for allegedly strangling her children, Cora, Dawson, and Callan, in January 2023.
Her defense plans an insanity plea, claiming postpartum mental illness and auditory hallucinations led to the tragic events.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly voted 10-5 for a home rule petition to create a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million.
The transfer fee, potentially raising $60 million annually, must be approved by the Massachusetts state legislature.
The fee would fund housing initiatives, with 90% of revenue returned to towns and 10% supporting a regional housing trust.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police are monitoring a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' scheduled for 3 p.m. Friday for public safety.
The proposed 'Northshore Mall takeover' is linked to car meetups involving vehicle blockades, donuts, and drag racing.
Governor Maura Healey condemned these activities, which led to a $14 million safety grant to prevent future incidents.
